jobDescription: Summary:  JOB SUMMARY: The incumbent will participate and guide the design, development, testing, implementation and on-going maintenance of new and existing applications. Analyze user requirement, procedures and problems to automate processing or to improve existing computer system. Maintain the flow of information in-between different computer systems.  EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, TRAINING  1. High School Diploma required for all new hires starting 4/1/14  2. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field preferred.  3. Knowledge of MS Office and Windows operating system platforms.  4. 1 year of applicable work experience required.  5. Working knowledge of a Health Information System preferred.  6. Knowledge of healthcare industry and hospital operations preferred.  Work Type: Full Time Employee  Shift: 1  Legend: Shift 1=Day, 2=Evening, 3=Night, 4=Varied.  We are an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status, disability, race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected characteristics. If you need special accommodation for the application process, please contact the Human Resources Department.  EEO is the law poster.
